sentences.en: A workman must sharpen his tools if he is to do his work well.
sentences.cn: 工欲善其事,必先利其器.

sentences.en: Anne sharpened her pencil and got out her homework.
sentences.cn: 安妮把铅笔削尖，然后拿出家庭作业来。

sentences.en: Ginny tried to sharpen up some rusty typing skills.
sentences.cn: 金尼试图重拾生疏了的打字技术。

sentences.en: He can't even sharpen a pencil properly.
sentences.cn: 他甚至连一支铅笔都削不好.

sentences.en: He started to sharpen his knife.
He started to sharpen his pencil.
He will need to sharpen his diplomatic skills in order to work with Congress.
sentences.cn: 他将需要增强外交技巧以与国会打交道。

sentences.en: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.cn: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。

sentences.en: If he really wants to sell his product, he'll have to get his marketing boys to sharpen up.
sentences.cn: 如果他真想卖出产品，就要让市场人员变得更机敏。

sentences.en: It began to sharpen with each stroke.
sentences.cn: 每蹬一下车子,疼痛都在加剧.

sentences.en: My pencil doesn't write well; I must sharpen it.
sentences.cn: 我的铅笔不好使; 我必须把它削尖.

sentences.en: Please sharpen the edge of this knife.
She needs to sharpen up before next month's competition.
sentences.cn: 下个月比赛之前,她的水平需要提高一下.

sentences.en: The training is designed to sharpen the fighter's reflexes.
sentences.cn: 这项训练是为了加快作战者的反应速度.

sentences.en: When you sharpen a pencil, you make chips.
sentences.cn: 你削铅笔时, 会削下许多碎屑.

sentences.en: You can sharpen your skills with rehearsal.
sentences.cn: 排练可以让技巧更加纯熟。

words.tran_cn: 急剧的；锋利的；强烈的；敏捷的；刺耳的
卷笔刀；[机] 磨具；研磨者
锐利；[摄] 清晰度；疾速；严厉

trans.tran_cn: （使）提高，改善，加强，加重，（使）变得锋利/清晰，（使声音）变得尖锐
trans.tran_en: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something
If you sharpen an object, you make its edge very thin or you make its end pointed
